entries.title: Judge Finds Amazon Broke Labor Law in Anti-Union Effort
entries.description: The ruling, on charges brought by the National Labor Relations Board, involved actions at two Staten Island warehouses before union votes last year.

entries.title: Snap’s Growth Slows Further Amid Tech Downturn
entries.description: The maker of Snapchat also swung to a loss in the latest quarter and declined to provide financial guidance.

entries.title: Tesla’s Self-Driving Technology Comes Under Justice Dept. Scrutiny
entries.description: A regulatory filing says officials have asked about software that Elon Musk, the chief executive, has said would allow cars to operate autonomously.

entries.title: Apple’s Secrecy Violated Workers Rights, NLRB Finds
entries.description: Following a yearlong investigation, a federal labor board determined that the tech giant’s rules interfere with employees’ right to organize.

entries.title: Thrive Capital Said to Lead Potential Investment in Stripe
entries.description: Thrive has committed $1 billion, which would value the payments provider Stripe at about $55 billion to $60 billion, people with knowledge of the matter said.
